item.title: February’s Free PlayStation Plus Games Announced
item.content:encoded:
Sony has announced the free games coming for PlayStation Plus members in February. As per usual, the games will be available for all active PlayStation Plus subscribers.

Starting on February 3, members will have four games from different genres to add to their library.

The headline game in February will be Undisputed from Steel City Interactive. First reported on earlier this week, Undisputed joins the catalog roughly 15 months after it’s 1.0 release.

Also coming is survival action-adventure game Subnautica: Below Zero, science fiction title Ultros, and the combat flight game Ace Combat 7: Skies Unknown.

As mentioned, the games will be available starting February 3 until March 2. Simply adding them to your library will give you continued access to install them when you want, as long as you have an active subscription.

If you haven’t yet, you have until February 2 to add January’s free games to your library. Those games include Need For Speed: Unbound, Disney’s Epic Mickey: Rebrushed, and Core Keeper. Again, you don’t have to download them right away to add them to your account.

What do you think of the four free games coming to PlayStation Plus in February? Leave your thoughts down in the comments below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the latest episode of the Developer Spotlight with Carmageddon: Rogue Shift Director Giuseppe Franchi. And for even more Insider Gaming delivered directly to your inbox, sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Mike has been covering the gaming industry since 2012, and has reported on some of the largest events in the industry while also working as an investigative reporter. Outside of…

More from Mike Straw

item.title: New Witcher Spinoff Title Releasing Next Month
item.content:encoded:
Reigns: The Witcher by Nerial and Devolver Digital releases for iOS, Android, Mac, and PC on February 25, 2026.

In recent days, we have been hearing a lot about the current and upcoming instalments of The Witcher series, including the rumoured expansion for The Witcher 3 and the development and marketing budgets for The Witcher 4. However, today we aren’t talking about any of these titles, but a spinoff within a choice-based title, Reigns.

Reigns: The Witcher Release Date Set for February 2026

Nerial and Devolver Digital have teamed up with CD Projekt Red to introduce a new spinoff titled Reigns: The Witcher, as announced in the recent reveal trailer. This game will incorporate Reigns’ signature decision-driven gameplay into The Witcher universe, featuring Geralt of Rivia as he navigates the ballads of Dandelion. Players will have the opportunity to explore a unique narrative experience, making choices that may involve running a hot bath instead of slaying monsters.

The game will also feature beloved characters from the series, including Yennefer, Triss, and Vesemir. Players can look forward to numerous combat mini-games, where Geralt will face off against familiar foes such as ghouls and rotfiends. Ultimately, the decisions made throughout the game will have significant consequences; a wrong choice could provoke the mages, while the right choice could earn you respect among the nobles.

In other news, The Witcher 3’s rumoured expansion could take players to a new region. Additionally, Netflix’s live-action adaptation will conclude in 2026. Will you be playing Reigns: The Witcher once it releases next month? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Scott Pilgrim EX releasing for PC and consoles in March 2026. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
